intro: Comostemum laetum, commonly known as the cheerful comostemum, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in shades of white and yellow. Its leaves are usually opposite and elliptical, with a smooth texture. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or rocky habitats.
